result.execSummary:
The defendant Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana

records.addlTxt: Case called at 11:30 AM.  Defendant Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana in court with attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez.  Jenna L Gill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Fred Svensson appeared.  Attorney Diaz informs the Court Defendant is changing her plea from Not Guilty to Guilty and a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Plea Agreement have been filed previously.  Court questions Defendant regarding Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form, Plea Agreement, and her plea change.   Court questions Attorney Diaz-Martinez regarding Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form, Plea Agreement and Defendant's plea change.  Defendant does understand the rights she is giving up.  Court is satisfied Defendant does enter her plea knowingly, freely, voluntarily, and intelligently and will accept her plea of Guilty on count 1-Disorderly Conduct.  Attorney Diaz makes a statement to the Court.  Court will accept recommendation and impose $100.00 fine + costs with 60 DTP.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 1:32 PM.  Defendant Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana in court with attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez (Special Appearance).  Jenna L Gill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Intrepreter Fred Svensson appeared.  Attorney Diaz-Martinez has filed plea questionnaire and waiver rights with the court.  In recess at 1:34 PM.  Case recalled at 1:42 PM.  Attorney Diaz-Martinez informs court settlement has been reached.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on February 16, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:17 PM.  Defendant Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana in court with attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez.   Jenna Gill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Fred Svensson appeared.  Attorney Diaz-Martinez informs the Court Defendant is entering not guilty plea and is waiving reading of criminal complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Daily Record of Appointment of Interpreter and Authorization for Payment
Adjourned initial appearance on January 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 1:54 PM.
Defendant Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Bucher appears for intake purposes.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Criminal complaint acknowledged, charge portion read onto the record.
Probable Cause found for filing.
State requests $1,000.00 signature bond, no threats towards Pliar Arroyo-Magana.
Warrant quashed.
So ordered.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Pilar Arroyo-Magana

Case called at 9:06 AM.
Defendant Diana Guadalupe Arroyo-Magana not in court.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves for warrant - non appearance (Lafayette and surrounding counties).
So ordered
Court finds probable cause for filing.
